com.github.powerlibraries.io.builder

Class StringOutBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.powerlibraries.io.builder.CharsetHolder<SELF>
      • com.github.powerlibraries.io.builder.BaseOutBuilder<StringOutBuilder>
        • com.github.powerlibraries.io.builder.StringOutBuilder

  • public class StringOutBuilder
extends BaseOutBuilder<StringOutBuilder>
    This builder is used to create an output chain. In contrast to the normal OutBuilder this class returns custom writers and streams that allow you to directly access the underlying byte buffer that is used as a final element in the chain and to directly return strings.
    Author:
    Manuel Hegner
    See Also:
    OutBuilder

        public java.lang.String writeXML(org.w3c.dom.Document document)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        This method writes the given XML document to the output. It uses a default TransformerFactory and Transformer.
        Parameters:
        document - the document to write
        Returns:
        the resulting string
        Throws:

      • writeObject

        public java.lang.String writeObject(java.lang.Object object)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        This method simply writes the given object to the underlying output using an ObjectOutputStream.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to serialize
        Returns:
        the resulting string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException

      • writeObjects

        public java.lang.String writeObjects(java.lang.Object... objects)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the given objects to the underlying output using an ObjectOutputStream. It does this by simply calling ObjectOutputStream.writeObject(Object) with each given object.
        Parameters:
        objects - the objects to serialize
        Returns:
        the resulting string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any element of the chain throws an IOException
